result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

PAYABLE TO CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE - 30 days to pay or request a payment plan.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

Plus supervision fees. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

2:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Wade Newell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JEVIEL R SHAW in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan J. Moertel in court for JEVIEL R SHAW. 
Amended information to be filed. 
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1; however, court acquiesces to DAGP and plea is not accepted at this time. 
Count 2, Defendant enters no contest plea. 
Factual basis and probable cause found. 
Court accepts plea for Count 2 as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty.
Plea hearing on June 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Wade Newell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JEVIEL R SHAW in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan J. Moertel in court for JEVIEL R SHAW. 
Information received. 
Not guilty plea entered.
Attorney Moertel requests speedy trial, currently scheduled. 
Bond continued.

11:04 AM  Attorney Wade Newell in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan J. Moertel in court for JEVIEL R SHAW.  Defendant JEVIEL R SHAW in court, in custody.  
Court calls case and notes appearances.
Witness Investigator D. Zehm is sworn and testifies.
Witness identifies the defendant.  
Exhibit 1 is offered; Attorney Moertel objects to exhibit; Exhibit 1 is received. Court orders exhibit be sealed and only available to parties.
Cross-examination by Attorney Moertel.
Attorney Wade Newell makes argument.
Attorney Moertel makes argument.
Court finds probable cause to support felony charge and binds defendant over for arraignment.
Bond continues.
Information will be filed.
Defendant is going to be requesting a speedy jury trial, so a trial is scheduled.
Scheduling Order for jury trial will be given as well.
Arraignment scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
